name: Immigration and Canadian Political Development
description: Immigration has played a central role in Canada's development. This course explores how policies aimed at regulating migration have both reflected and helped construct conceptions of Canadian national identity. We will pay particular attention to the politics of immigration policy-making, focusing on the role of the state and social actors.Areas of Focus: Canadian Government and Politics; Public Policy
prerequisites: [[POLB50Y3 or equivalent] and [1.5 credits at the C-level in POL or PPG courses]] or [15.0 credits including SOCB60H3]
